channel.title: First JAVA Program You Ever Wrote?
channel.description:
What was the first java program you ever wrote, we do not need it to have a link.
Just describe what it was, and if it was hard to make.
EDIT: Just wrote my first basic calculator w00t

item.title: First JAVA Program You Ever Wrote?
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[quote=“DivineSouls, post:75, topic:350089”]Now it is, true. You have to learn all of that first. I doubt that he just opened up notepad and wrote that.
You read up on stuff, but before learning all that he must have done something in notepad prior to that guessing game like Hello World or something similar to that.
Well…He could have found a random lesson online that teaches that as lesson 1.[/quote]or he could have just googled ‘java input’ and ‘java random number’ and worked it out from there, i’d assume there would be some initiative

Read full topic
item.source: First JAVA Program You Ever Wrote?

item.title: First JAVA Program You Ever Wrote?
item.dc:creator: @John459 John459
item.description:
@John459 wrote:

[quote=“DivineSouls, post:73, topic:350089”][quote author=Canownueazy link=topic=446456.msg3348283#msg3348283 date=1285017013]
Something stupid and hardcoded like this

[code]import java.util.Random;
import java.util.Scanner;

public class GuessingGame {

public static void main(String[] args) {
    Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in);
    System.out.print("Guess a number (1-5): ");
    int answer = Integer.parseInt(scanner.next().trim());
    Random random = new Random();

// Fat Cookies would like to say that this object is absolutely useless
int randomNumber = (int)(Math.random() * (5)) + 1;
if(randomNumber == answer) {
System.out.println(“You won, go screw a cow!”);
return;
}
System.out.println(“You lost, go die.”);
}
}[/code]
[/quote]

I HIGHLY doubt that was your first program.[/quote]

Why? It’s simple. I can easily believe that to be his first program.

Read full topic
item.source: First JAVA Program You Ever Wrote?
